text: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

text: I don't care if it works on your machine! We are not shipping your machine!
author: Vidiu Platon

text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

text: Copy-and-Paste was programmed by programmers for programmers actually.
author: Anonymous

text: Algorithm: Word used by programmers when they don't want to explain what they did.
author: Anonymous

text: Hardware: The parts of a computer system that can be kicked.
author: Jeff Pesis

text: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
author: Seymour Cray

text: Ruby is rubbish! PHP is phpantastic!
author: Nikita Popov

text: Coding is the easy part. Naming variables is the hard part.
author: Anonymous

text: If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Anonymous

text: Programmer: A machine that turns coffee into code.
author: Anonymous

text: Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
author: Anonymous

text: When I wrote this code, only God and I knew how it worked. Now, only God knows!
author: Anonymous

text: A SQL query walks into a bar, walks up to two tables and asks, 'Can I join you?'
author: Anonymous

text: How many programmers does it take to change a light bulb? None. It's a hardware problem.
author: Anonymous

text: Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs.
author: Anonymous

text: Things aren't always #000000 and #FFFFFF
author: Anonymous

text: I simply wait for the cat to walk over the keyboard.
author: Charles Bukowski (Attributed)

text: My code’s so clean, you could eat off it.
author: Anonymous

text: While there's code, there's a bug.
author: Anonymous

text: Home is where the wifi connects automatically.
author: Anonymous

text: There is no place like 127.0.0.1
author: Anonymous

text: Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kick boxing.
author: Emo Philips

text: To err is human, but to really foul things up you need a computer.
author: Paul R. Ehrlich

text: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Java is to JavaScript as ham is to hamster.
author: Jeremy Keith

text: The C Programming Language: A language which combines the flexibility of assembly language with the power of assembly language.
author: Anonymous

text: One man’s constant is another man’s variable.
author: Alan Perlis

text: Syntactic sugar causes cancer of the semi-colons.
author: Alan Perlis

text: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

text: It is easier to change the specification to fit the program than it is to agree on one.
author: Alan Perlis

text: Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.
author: Nathan Myhrvold
